articles.title: In the hands, Phantom Blade Zero owes more to Ninja Gaiden than Soulslikes

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Ten years ago, we were drowning in early access survival games about chopping trees and crafting camp fires. Rust pit monstrous players against one another, DayZ had us dashing around for beans and bleach, while The Forest creeped us the hell out in a dark jungle. There was even a week-long celebration here at RPS called survival week to get the genre out of our systems. A lot of those games have since graduated to a full 1.0 release, but one survivalist shambled on. 7 Days To Die is a solid sandbox craft 'em up with zombie hordes, and it never left the comfort of its early access log cabin surrounded by spikes and land mines. But a (tentative) release date is finally on the horizon, according to the developers. And it's quite soon.
Read more
articles.title: After 10 years in early access, 7 Days To Die finally has a release date for version 1.0

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
This piece is written in memory of the Alpha Doshaguma, a huge furry quadruped with the belly, gait and mournful disposition of an orphaned St Bernard, which - no, who was sleeping blamelessly in a canyon when Capcom's demo presenter strolled up and bopped it with a bayonet howitzer. The demo in question was for Monster Hunter Wilds, which they probably should rename Monster Hadron Collider in that a major selling point appears to be making the megafauna converge and murder each other. It's possible to do this in previous games, especially 2018's Monster Hunter: World, but not like this. Not like this. Alas for the Alpha Doshaguma. Getting rocket-speared in the bum was only the start of its worst day ever.

 
Read more
articles.title: RIP Alpha Doshaguma, the doomed dragonfighting guinea pig of my Monster Hunter Wilds demo

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Phantom Line, the PVE co-op shooter formerly known as Hornet, has an early demo available until the 18th of June, 2024. It’s from Antistatic Studios, who include former Cyberpunk 2077, Bioshock, and Borderlands devs among their ranks. The FPS lets you and up to three great mates fill the ectoplasm-stained tactical boots worn by members of the ‘paranormal SWAT’, where you’ll explore large maps and try to contain strange goings on. You’ll need to join the game’s Discord if you want to play. Trailer below.
 
Read more
articles.title: Phantom Line, the "paranormal SWAT" shooter from former Cyberpunk and Bioshock devs, has a time-limited demo

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Mental Salvo describes itself as having an "infinite open world" in which you can do so many things, "they're impossible to list". Were this a game from a triple-A publisher, I'd be heading down to their compound with some powerful magnets and cannisters of highly concentrated acid to wipe out their ungodly creation before it replaces the fundamental particles of our universe with waypoints. But Mental Salvo is actually the work of new indie imaginini (yes, no capital-I), and is a "top down art adventure with light RPG elements" that is perhaps a bit ZANY but also, refreshingly playful in essentially being about poking a big white screen to see what tumbles out of it.
 
Read more
articles.title: Mental Salvo is an "infinite open world" art game full of procedurally generated surprises

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Excuse me, sorry, pardon me, can I just, thank you, ah, sorry, thanks... Phew, made it. Steam Next Fest is pretty crowded, eh? As if the unholy swarm of trailers and game announcements from Summer Game Fest was not enough, this week the fearful megalords at Valve decided to drop their regular cavalcade of coming-soons onto their megastore. The beautiful (and terrifying) thing about Next Fest, of course, is the overwhelming number of demos that come out during the event. A small herd of video games are standing on my toes as we speak. But that's okay, we are expert curators. Here's a handy list of our nine favourite demos of the lot.
Read more
articles.title: Our 9 favourite demos from the summer Steam Next Fest

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
In what is possibly the biggest scandal the UK has seen since the last time the price of Freddos went up, a digital rights campaigner is suing Valve for £656m in compensation, accusing the company of overcharging and anti-competitive behaviour. The accompanying website describes the collective action claim as a “ground-breaking legal action,” which is very gamer of them. 16 times the litigation, etc.
 
Read more
articles.title: Valve owe you 44 quid, according to a £656m lawsuit against the company for allegedly overcharging UK customers

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
It’s been a decade - 10 years! - since Dragon Age: Inquisition. It’s fair to assume that you might’ve forgotten what happened during the last Dragon Age game, or some of the specific choices you made back in the misty ages of 2014. Whether you remember or not, this year’s long-awaited sequel Dragon Age: The Veilguard should have you covered, with the ability to carry over your story choices from the previous game and get a refresher on what happened last time around.
Read more
articles.title: Dragon Age: The Veilguard will let you bring over your choices from Inquisition - whether you still have your save or not

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Shadow Of The Erdtree is out in under 10 days, but some players must be in for a surprise if they expect to be able to jump in straight away. As it turns out, most players on Steam haven’t even progressed far enough in the original game to access the DLC - something publishers Bandai Namco have now issued a friendly FYI about.
Read more
articles.title: Most Elden Ring players on Steam won’t even be able to play its Shadow of the Erdtree DLC next week

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
When I was a kid, one of my absolute favourite things to do on the PC was to mess around with a free virtual Felix - like the cat from the cat food adverts - who would roam around the Windows XP desktop, chasing balls of string between program windows and curling up to take a nap on the taskbar. I have no idea where the game came from - a dream, perhaps - but 30 years later, I still think about it as a perfectly formed way to lose hours on the PC without actually doing anything.
Read more
articles.title: Virtual pet sim Weyrdlets is like Animal Crossing on your desktop, except you might get some real-life work done too

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Sumo Group, the British video game collective which owns developers Sumo Digital, publishers Secret Mode and more - including Everybody's Gone to the Rapture devs The Chinese Room - is laying off hundreds of staff, cutting 15% of their workforce “to better navigate the upcoming challenges expected in the coming months”.
Read more
articles.title: Still Wakes the Deep, Warhammer 40,000: Boltgun and Deathsprint 66 makers to lay off hundreds of staff

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
“When I was young,” the villager washing garments in the river says, “I thought it was enough to clean the dirty laundry once and be calm. Not that it will get dirty forever.” I’m not sure I’ve ever felt the crushing weight of universal entropic decay so keenly as in that RPG maker textbox, nested upon Felvidek’s nicotine-stain hues. I’ll need to clean my keyboard soon. I keep taking screenshots of Felvidek. I can’t take enough. I want to make a scrapbook of every character and every line. Neither my laundry nor keyboard will ever be clean forever either, but if I hate Felvidek for emphasising that, I love it for reminding me that all the best art is buttressed by an irremovable layer of deep, thick grime.
 
Read more
articles.title: Felvidek review: a black comedy medieval RPG that’s all about honeyed words and grubby deeds

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
No, it's not Silversun. Sit down, Brian. Let somebody else have a go at answering. Citizen Sleeper 2: Starward Vector is a sci-fi RPG with plenty of dice and a heavy nod towards tabletop role-playing. The first Citizen Sleeper saw your bio-robotic protagonist landing on a donut-shaped space station where they learned to make a new life for themselves among interstellar farmers and ramen-serving rapscallions. In the sequel, a demo of which I've played [smug face], the hook is a little different. This time you're being pursued across a bunch of backwater truck stops, colonies, depots, and derelicts. All the while your misfit crew will clash and commingle. You still haven't got it, have you? Ugh. I suppose I'll let the game's designer tell you then.
Read more
articles.title: Can you guess which Australian TV sci-fi of the early 2000s inspired Citizen Sleeper 2?

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Disco Samurai is a game that’s so difficult I’d have given up playing sooner if it didn’t contain so many of my absolute favourite action game things. Tense, decisive duels. Violence that’s both brutal and a little silly. Scalpel-sharp parry n' strike back-and-forths. Short stages that dole out chunky progression hits of dopamine, as quickly as they wrest those hits away from you with another humbling beatdown. Perhaps most importantly, it aims to do one thing - rhythm combat - and does it brilliantly. It's got teeth, but it's also got groove.
 
Read more
articles.title: Disco Samurai is a brutally difficult and brilliant Sekiro-like rhythm slasher

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
On a Monday in early 2018, Adam Smith, Rock Paper Shotgun's deputy editor at the time, handed in his notice. On Thursday that same week, I emailed Alice Bell, a person I'd never spoken to before, to ask if she would consider applying for the role.

Alice thought it over for a week, and then emailed her response: no.

Thank god I was able to change her mind, so I could spend the next six years giving her shit about it. But now Alice is leaving RPS, and you should join me in saying goodbye.

 
Read more
articles.title: Alice B is leaving RPS, come say goodbye

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
US labour union the CWA (Communications Workers of America) have filed Unfair Labor Practice charges against Activision QA supplier Lionbridge Technologies. As Game Developer reports, the CWA allege that Lionbridge fired an entire 160-person team in Idaho in retaliation for union-related activities.
Read more
articles.title: Activision QA supplier Lionbridge accused of retaliatory layoffs in "union busting" move

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
I try to avoid describing video games in mathematical terms, but I can hardly avoid it here. Treasure Planet's flying galleons plus Spirited Away's bath house plus Spiritfarer's gentle building and management mechanics equals Hotel Galactic. Watch the trailer below and tell me I'm wrong.

 
Read more
articles.title: Hotel Galactic is a cosy management game that aims to channel Spirited Away

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
I'm a little sheepish about how much I'm looking forward to Cat Quest 3. It's neither big budget and mainstream, nor a conceptually thrilling indie. If the first two games are anything to go by, it'll be a paint-by-numbers action-RPG with simple combat, lots of grind, and endless cat and dog puns.

Yeah. That's why I like it, though. Now it has a release date: August 8th.

 
Read more
articles.title: Charming action-RPG Cat Quest 3 releases this August and there's a Steam Next Fest demo now

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Caves Of Qud has been under development for over 15 years, but it's finally reaching a 1.0 release later this year. Ahead of that happening, it's received a final major content update which seeks to make the complex, detailed roguelike more approachable. The Spring Molting update, which is out now, makes the user interface work with both mouse and gamepad, adds Steam cloud saves, and more.

 
Read more
articles.title: Caves Of Qud's final update before 1.0 adds new UI, and mouse and gamepad support

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
I've never played League Of Legends and I have no interest in doing so, but Arcane was superb. Set within the world of Riot's MOBA and starring several of its playable characters, Netflix's mini series was better animated and better written than any of its peers.

A second season is on the way and due to arrive this November. Its teaser trailer also refers to it as "the final chapter".

 
Read more
articles.title: Arcane's second season will be its last, says its first trailer

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
It took over a month of racing and 220 hours of playtime but a Trackmania player has finally beaten the racing game's most horrendously difficult map. For those of you only now noticing that tens of thousands of Twitch viewers have been religiously watching video game Hot Wheels, let me elucidate. Deep Dip 2 is a fan-made tower of racetracks that was published as a challenge to the racing game's community last month. It is 16 floors of unfathomably difficult ramps, tunnels, ledges, pipes, and beams. A simple mistake sees drivers plummeting to the bottom, like the sad cauldron man of Getting Over It. The first three players to finish would share a prize pool of over $32,000. Over the weekend, one player has now managed it, and another has since joined him. Third place is still up for grabs but, mate, I wouldn't recommend it.
Read more
articles.title: Someone finally beat the hardest racetrack ever made in Trackmania, and it only took them 220 hours to finish

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Good news, everybody! Dragon Age: The Veilguard - previously Dragon Age: Dreadwolf, strictly speaking Dragon Age 4 - is not the bantzy heist romp suggested by its debut trailer. Less Good News for returning players: going by the 45 minute segment I was shown at Summer Game Fest, Dragon Age: The Veilguard is more of a single-character action-RPG plus entourage, than a proper party-based affair in the vein of 2014's Dragon Age: Inquisition. You do get a party, drawn from a retinue of seven, larger-than-life, romanceable companions encompassing a range of classes, abilities and go-faster hairdos, but control of that party has been streamlined, and there's a God Of Warlike emphasis on booting Fade demons into pits. Hmmm.
 
Read more
articles.title: The first 45 minutes of Dragon Age: The Veilguard feel as much like Mass Effect 2 as Inquisition

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
I’ve always loved the art of the Metal Slug series of side-scrolling shooters, so I’ve been keeping a keen eye on the fetching grid strategy antics of Metal Slug Tactics ever since it was first announced. For as long as I’ve been excited, I’ve also been worried. It’s been a polarising experience, like being alternately fed delicious sandwiches and those inedible rotlogs they sell at Subway. Still, I’ve remained cautious: is all this great pixel-art just a shroud pulled over a ho-hum tactics game to rescue it from naffness? It’s with this in mind I hungrily dove into the Steam Next Fest demo, as one might hungrily dive into a bin to eat literal garbage if their only other option was Subway.
 
Read more
articles.title: Metal Slug Tactics’ demo is pure nostalgia for better and worse

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
AI nowadays is big business and it's pretty terrifying, honestly. FACEMINER captures both of these things well, as it sees you build a biometric data processing empire from scratch. And most scary of all, is you'll relish upscaling your organisation as you mine mugshots. I mean, I went from, "Hmmm, this is dubious", to a sicko excited by the fact I didn't have to click much to harvest strangers' portraits. Nic wrote about it a while back, but I'd like to draw attention to it again as it's very good.
Read more
articles.title: FACEMINER is a dystopian management sim where you'll take great pleasure in harvesting mugshots for money

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
What a thrill! Oh, wait, actually no. It’s just a release date. We get those all the time. Still, I’m not entirely un-thrilled to learn that stealth action game Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater could be arriving as soon as the 17th of November this year, according to a hastily scrubbed X post by retailer GameStop. Thankfully, the folks at the (good, handsome) Ian Games Network grabbed the offending information square before it was deleted. Here’s said square:
Read more
articles.title: Leak suggests a Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater release date exactly 20 years after the original

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
The playable area in Caravan SandWitch’s Steam Next Fest demo isn’t all that big, but within seconds you’re plonked at the rusty wheel of an offroading motorhome and let loose to roam it. It’s a figurative "Go nuts," and given how much more this narrative-heavy, third-person exploration yarn seemingly has to give, it's an attitude I’m seriously hoping holds firm throughout the full game.
Read more
articles.title: The Caravan SandWitch demo teases a gorgeous exploration-adventure

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
It’s a well known phenomena by now that if you want to level up very quickly in Elden Ring, the best place to do so is a cliff’s edge by Mohgwyn Palace. Nearby to this now-famous site of grace camps a merry band of blood-cursed Albinaurics, as well as a stupid gross bird you can trick into killing itself over and over again. I do not give a single solitary biscuit about that leperous avian, but I’ll be damned if I’m going to waste my new-found position of prominence on this glorious website by not moralising at you heartless rune-hoarders about the unconscionable violence you keep inflicting on my bulbous, shiny frog sons. With Elden Ring: Shadow Of The Erdtree out soon, the amount of violence the community is collectively inflicting is breaking my tiny heart.
 
Read more
articles.title: PSA: Please leave my horrible silver frog sons alone as you grind for Elden Ring Shadow Of The Erdtree

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
It’s been almost a decade since Rebel Galaxy ably picked up the sci-fi trading and exploration mantle handed down by Freelancer, but it looks like a successor to the serene galaxy-venturing vibes of both is finally upon us. Star Trucker is exactly what it sounds like, transplanting the chill A-to-Z courier journeys of Euro Truck Simulator to the interplanetary, uh, roads of space. It’s out this September, and it looks wonderful.
Read more
articles.title: Star Trucker delivers its chill mix of Euro Truck Simulator and Freelancer onto Steam and Game Pass this September

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
For me, sandbox games are never better when there’s an inherent chaos about to erupt at any given second. In a literal sandbox that might be anything from a kid burying a freshly-laid turd like a mischievous cat ready to be stepped on by an unsuspecting trespasser, gathering handfuls of grit to lob in a another kids’ eyes or swallowing a bunch of sand (hopefully turd-free) in pursuit of alchemising diamonds in their stomach. There don’t seem to be turds of any kind in upcoming sandbox RPG Streets of Fortuna, but that’s about the only thing that this ambitious “megasim” appears to be missing in its sprawling go-anywhere, do-anything open world.
Read more
articles.title: Streets of Fortuna is a chaotic The Sims-like in an ambitious open-world city sandbox, made with the help of Dwarf Fortress creators

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
I've been trying to figure out what "scoundrelly" means in a videogame context. Whatever it means, Han Solo homage Star Wars Outlaws ain't it. Here are some basically non-scoundrelly, very Ubisofty things I did during my 60 minutes with Massive Entertainment's open world adaptation at Summer Game Fest this week: climbed around rectangular arrangements of yellow handholds. Shot at baddies over rectangular cover layouts. Collected 7/10 pieces of scrap with some Star Wars flavour text that unlocked an item recipe of some kind. Deployed my chibi Chewbacca sidekick Nix to distract Imperials with cute wiggles and belly boops so I could sneak behind them. Got discovered sneaking behind them and murdered them all before one could run to a terminal and summon reinforcements. OK, maybe that last one is getting there.
 
Read more
articles.title: Star Wars Outlaws feels about as Han Solo-ish as, well, an Ubisoft open world game

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
It’s been five years since Anno 1800, but we’ve finally seen what’s next for Ubisoft’s history-hopping city-building series. Anno 117: Pax Romana will be the earliest period for the franchise yet, travelling back to the time of a peaceful Ancient Rome. After the biggest gap between Anno games yet, we at least won’t have to wait too long for the newly revealed entry: it’s out next year.
Read more
articles.title: Anno 117: Pax Romana takes the city-builder series back to Ancient Rome next year

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Assassin’s Creed has been threatening to go to Japan for so long that I think the idea has lost its thunder, but I’ll admit to a squee of enthusiasm, during our first look at Assassin’s Creed Shadows, when deuteragonist Naoe grappled onto the ceiling to allow a castle guard to pass innocently beneath. I was similarly tickled by the sight of her breathing through a bamboo pipe while swimming underwater, and I emitted a gentle hum of approval, like a smartphone switching on for the very first time, when she impaled a silhouette through a paper door. Respectable shinobing, for sure. Papa Tenchu would be proud.

 
Read more
articles.title: Assassin’s Creed Shadows is actually two games competing for your affections

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Ubisoft’s remake of time-rewinding Prince of Persia classic The Sands of Time has finally reappeared to tease - with the emphasis on tease - a release not this year, not next year, but in 2026.
Read more
articles.title: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time remake resurfaces after years of silence to tease a release… in 2026

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
It's a good thing I'm a big fan of Prince Of Persia: The Lost Crown, because it's only that underyling fandom that's making me write this post about the upcoming story DLC. The tease during this evening's Ubisoft Forward did nothing for me, other than confirm a name, Mask Of Darkness, and a release window in September.

 
Read more
articles.title: Prince Of Persia: The Lost Crown's first story DLC, Mask Of Darkness, arrives in September

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
How do you like your coffee? For those who answer: "served by a barista with ten arms wearing a mask adorned with intense scarlet lipstick", you are in luck. The multi-limbed coffee shop owner of Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn is, indeed, a reassuring sight, since they are the ones who sell the player fashionable jackets and trousers to wear while you axe enemy heads to bloody fragments. In this soon-to-sally-forth soulslike from the makers of Ashen, the creature design is a highlight. Whether it's a good souls 'em up remains to be seen. I've only played a couple of hours in the Steam Next Fest demo. But I want to make clear that, among the reservations I've collected on my murder jaunt, nothing will diminish the espresso-pumping hand-haver of the game's first café.
Read more
articles.title: The combat in Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn feels a bit floaty, but at least its café staff have ten hands

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
I Am Your Beast is a tactical, smack-tical, I hope this tree branch doesn’t crack-tical while I’m hopping off it to land on this dude’s back-tical FPS. It’s from Strange Scaffold, of El Paso, Elsewhere and Booked For The Week fame. It is a euphoric splurge of murderous game verbiage that has you chaining together thrown knives and solar plexus punches, headshots and tree-fu. Lob an empty pistol at your screen, and then replace it, because you’ll need it to watch the trailer below.
 
Read more
articles.title: I Am Your Beast is a John Wick-ensian FPS from the El Paso, Elsewhere developer

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
One of my absolute most favouritest Steam Deck cases, besides the one you get for free with the Steam Deck OLED, is the Dbrand Project Killswitch. It’s not so much a carrying vessel as a hardened second skin, providing protection without all the bag-hogging bulk of a traditional case – while throwing in handy bonuses like a clip-on kickstand and grippy thumbstick covers. For owners of the Asus ROG Ally, the recent launch of a Project Killswitch for their own handheld PC should therefore represent glad tidings with extra gladness, even if it won’t also fit the upcoming ROG Ally X.
Thank the new device’s bigger battery, wider SSD and reworked connection layout for that particular lack of forwards compatibility, as the ROG Ally X’s thicker dimensions will make it just slightly too beefy to slip into the Killswitch’s skintight silicone. A shame, but at least it makes a quality addition to the original Ally right this second. I’ve been manhandling one for a week now, and it’s just as practical and protective as the Steam Deck version.
Read more
articles.title: It won’t fit the Asus ROG Ally X, but Dbrand’s Project Killswitch is a lovely upgrade for the original Ally

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Shown off at the PC Gaming Show the other day, Generation Exile is a sustainable turn-based citybuilder with some real talent behind it. It's being developed by Sonderlust Studios, headed up by Mark Of The Ninja's lead designer Nels Anderson, alongside other talented developers like Karla Zimonja, who worked on Gone Home. Yeah, it's definitely one to watch.
Read more
articles.title: Generation Exile is a new sustainable citybuilder from the Mark Of The Ninja and Gone Home devs

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Chef RPG is Stardew Valley but for restaurants instead of farms, the ‘plate’ side of the hypothetical ‘farm to plate’ bundle that Steam may one day sell. Even the set-up is similar to the farming game. You rock up all chef-like off the train, and you're soon greeted by your guide Hazel, yet another Boba-clutching robot. I might be misremembering Stardew. Fry yourself off a nice chunk of trai-loumi below.
 
Read more
articles.title: Chef RPG is a foodie Stardew Valley where you brew your own drinks and try to keep the critics happy

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
We continue to rummage through the debris caused by the horrendous pile-up of summer video game announcements. Among the wreckage, a release date for Tactical Breach Wizards, the funny strategy game in which you play a ragtag crew of uniformed magic-zappers clearing enemies in confined spaces. It's not XCOM, but it is XCOM-ing soon. That's about as good a joke as I can muster on a Monday morning. Don't worry, there are funnier ones in the trailer below.
Read more
articles.title: Tactical Breach Wizards gets a summer release window, then throws a man through it

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
"Deus Ex but tiny and hilarious" is how I pitch the first Streets of Rogue to people in elevators. Then I kick the elevator control panel to pieces, climb out the hatch, and cut the cord with a buzzsaw I smuggled in earlier. "It's also total chaos!" I yell, as the elevator plummets. "Ha ha ha ha ha ha!" Streets of Rogue 2 is looking similarly chaotic. But one thing has been brought to order: its release date. It's coming to early access on August 14th, while a new trailer (below) shows horse riding, flame throwing, and speed boating. My favourite moment is when a man pumps magic gas into a room full of people doing zumba, and it turns them all into giants, and they freak out and start smashing the walls in a panic.
Read more
articles.title: Do a drive-by shooting from the back of a bear in Streets of Rogue 2 this summer

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
The god of video games news is vengeful, for this weekend He has sent forth a flood of game announcements to wipe out any remaining game journalists from this earth. Come at me, God! What have you got? Ah. It’s Ale Abbey, a management game about brewing beer in a monastery of medieval monks, and between making craft ales the priests get tipsy on their own supply. You can’t fool me, god of game reveals, this one has been openly in the works on GameJolt for 2 years. But, yes, I suppose now that the developer is teaming up with the Northgard creators as a publisher, the people must know.

 
Read more
articles.title: Boozy management sim Ale Abbey puts you in the sandals of a beer-brewing monk

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
The Artful Escape developers Beethoven & Dinosaur are following up their musical platformer with another soundtrack-driven narrative game. Mixtape draws on the classic tropes of coming-of-age teen flicks, adds striking stop motion-style visuals and completes the package with a soundtrack that would feel right at home in a John Hughes movie.
Read more
articles.title: Annapurna’s Mixtape is a coming-of-age teen summer adventure with skating, romance and a banging soundtrack

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Sonda do světa otevřeného softwaru. Dnes si otestujeme sítě, vyzkoušíme aplikaci pro automatické klikání, dáme si dohromady svoje úkoly pomocí Kanbanu a podíváme se na prohlížeč 3D modelů.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (19. 6. 2024): automatické klikání myší pro Wayland i X11

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: V dnešním článku se seznámíme se základními vlastnostmi projektu py2many, který dokáže překládat zdrojové kódy z Pythonu do dalších jazyků, včetně C++, Rustu, Go či jazyku Julia.
articles.title: Projekt py2many: transpiler Pythonu do dalších programovacích jazyků

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Kopřiva)
articles.description: V dnešním díle Postřehů se podíváme na novinky okolo návrhu zákona o kybernetické bezpečnosti, změny v plánovaném nasazení funkce Recall do Windows nebo kompromitaci desítek tisíc zařízení FortiGate ze strany čínských státních aktérů…
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: novela zákona o kybernetické bezpečnosti doporučena ke schválení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Unixový operační systém Redox OS využívá komponenty prostředí COSMIC. Centrum aplikací Ubuntu přidává podporu instalátoru balíčků DEB. Distribuce AlmaLinux OS oficiálně podporuje jednodeskový počítač Raspberry Pi 5.
articles.title: COSMIC na Redox OS, Ubuntu s instalátorem DEB

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nové Human Interface Guidelines pro KDE, Wine 9.11 opravuje 27 chyb, Intel Vulkan se spustí téměř dvakrát rychleji, oprava pro AMD Ryzeny: už se probudí ze spánku i s NVMe SSD.
articles.title: Správně se budící Ryzeny s NVMe, Plasma 6.1 už za několik hodin

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Z průzkumu, který projekt FreeBSD provedl v poslední době mezi svými uživateli, vyplývá řada zajímavostí. Podívejme se blíže, jak se dnes typicky FreeBSD používá i jaký je jeho uživatel.
articles.title: Uživatelé hodnotí FreeBSD v roce 2024: přidat na komunitě, díky za ZFS a stabilitu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Michal Tauchman)
articles.description: Disketovka k osmibitu byl dříve nedostižný sen, tak jsem si jednu koupil. V poslední části se budeme věnovat postupu, jak vytvořit vlastní disketu a také, jak se projeví použití cartridge Fast Load.
articles.title: Commodore 1541-II: vytváření vlastních disket a použití cartridge Fast Load

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Pipeline je v současném IT jedno z nejzneužívanějších slov. V jazyku Coconut lze pipeline používat ve smyslu kolon, tedy pro zajištění předávání návratových hodnot funkcí do jiných funkcí, což je základ tacit programmingu.
articles.title: Konstrukce kolon a kompozice funkcí v jazyku Coconut

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: The Mirror, alternativa ke hře Roblox, uvolnil svůj zdrojový kód. Neoficiální port hry Zelda se jmenuje 2 Ship 2 Harkinian. Klasika Descent 3 od Outrage Entertainment je nyní k dispozici pod svobodnou licencí.
articles.title: Hra The Mirror je open-source, klon Zeldy se jmenuje 2 Ship 2 Harkinian

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jiří Sluka)
articles.description: V dnešní sklizni se ponoříme do světa komunikace, bezpečnosti a prezentací. Představíme si nástroje, které vám umožní udržet kontakt s vaším sociálním okruhem, ochránit vaše digitální data a prezentovat vaše myšlenky v terminálu.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (12. 6. 2024): jedna aplikace na všechny komunikační sítě

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Vilém Sládek)
articles.description: Dnes a zítra se téměř v celé Evropě koná cvičení Cyber Europe. V letošním roce je primárním cílem této akce otestovat připravenost energetického průmyslu, jako sekundární cílová skupina byla zvolena datacentra, která hrají klíčovou roli ve fungování digitální infrastruktury.
articles.title: Probíhá celoevropské cvičení Cyber Europe 2024

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Vilém Sládek)
articles.description: Sdružení CZ.NIC vydalo novou verzi desktopové Datovky. Mezi novinky verze 4.24.0 patří nové rozložení ovládacích prvků v hlavním okně aplikace nebo přidání parametrů pro příkazovou řádku pro práci s uloženými daty.
articles.title: Do nové verze Datovky byly přidány parametry pro příkazovou řádku pro práci s uloženými daty

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Oblíbený „linuxový“ notebook Framework Laptop 13 bude možné v blízké budoucnosti zcela předělat pomocí nové základní desky na platformu RISC-V (foto výše je pouze ilustrační). Deska byla vytvořena ve spolupráci se společností DeepComputing a jde o budoucí „upgrade“ pro ty, kterým není AMD či Intel dostatečně svobodným řešením.
articles.title: Framework Laptop 13 nabídne základní desku s RISC-V

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Na světě je první dílčí aktualizace šestkové Plasmy. Verze 6.1 přináší pár dílčích vylepšení a opravy řady věcí nahlášených uživateli zejména po vydání šestky.
articles.title: KDE Plasma 6.1 vylepšuje uživatelský zážitek i běh na Waylandu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Proxmox je moderní virtualizační platforma, která v mnoha případech může nahradit VMware. Je open-source, zdarma a je postaven na otevřených technologiích jako KVM, LXC, CEPH a dalších. Pokud potřebujete provozovat virtualizaci, Proxmox je pro vás ideální stack a na našem workshopu Proxmox se dozvíte, jak na něj.
articles.title: Proxmox: moderní virtualizační platforma schopná nahradit VMware (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Společnost Nvidia je v tuto chvíli tou, která má na světě nejvyšší tržní hodnotu. Dle posledních analýz agentury Bloomberg dosáhla 3,349 biliónů USD, což je o pár desítek miliard dolarů více, než Microsoft s 3,325, resp. Apple s 3,275 bilióny USD.
articles.title: Nvidia je nejhodnotnější firmou na světě, přeskočila Apple i Microsoft

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nová verze The Amnestic Incognito Live System vylepšuje používaný kryptografický systém. Tails nyní ukládá random seed na USB flashku, což z hlediska bezpečnosti ocení mnohé komponenty na dobře zajištěné šifrování spoléhající (perzistentní úložiště, Tor či HTTPS). „Semínko“ je uloženo mimo perzistentní úložiště.
articles.title: Tails 6.4 vylepšuje šifrování

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Phoronix otestoval aktuální FreeBSD 14.1, NetBSD 10.0 a DragonFlyBSD 6.4 oproti Ubuntu 24.04 LTS a CentOS 9, a to na AMD Threadripperu 7980X. Navazuje tak na nedávné srovnání mezi FreeBSD 14.0 a 14.1.
articles.title: Tři BSD versus CentOS a Ubuntu: FreeBSD 14.1 v průměru nejrychlejší

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Jako součást prací na budoucí Fedoře 41 vznikají další úpravy instalátoru GNOME Software. S nimi se uživatelům usnadní cesta k instalaci uzavřeného ovladače Nvidia, a to na systémech se zapnutým UEFI Secure Boot. Ovladač Nvidie byl dříve z GNOME Software odstraněn právě kvůli nemožnosti jeho běhu na systému zabezpečeném Secure Bootem, což se změnilo.
articles.title: GNOME Software dostane podporu instalace uzavřeného ovladače Nvidia na strojích se Secure Bootem

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Nebezpečná zranitelnost CVE-2024–3080 byla objevena v sedmi WiFi routerech Asus. Útočník může bez znalosti hesla vzdáleně obejít přihlašování a přihlásit se do routeru. Zranitelné jsou modely XT8, XT8_V2, RT-AX88U, RT-AX58U, RT-AX5&, RT-AC86U a RT-AC68U.
articles.title: Nebezpečné zranitelnosti WiFi routerů Asus

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Meta dala uživatelům v EU čas jen do 26. června, aby se vyjádřili, pokud nechtějí na svých datech trénovat AI (opt-out). Na tento postup si stěžovalo evropské centrum pro digitální práva noyb. Buď pomohla stížnost anebo hodně uživatelů využilo opt-out.
articles.title: Meta pozastavila plány s trénováním AI na Facebooku a Instagramu v EU

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Pokud máte notebook s grafickou kartou Nvidia, vyhněte se binárnímu ovladači 550. Ten může způsobovat náhodné zatuhnutí a pády.
articles.title: Nepoužívejte ovladače Nvidia 550 na notebooku, hrozí pády

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Knihovna Pythonu pro numerické vědecké výpočty NumPy vyšla včera ve verzi 2.0.0. Mezi novinky patří rychlejší řazení ( sort, argsort, partition a argpartitions), protože se používá SIMD knihovna Google Highway a také x86-simd-sort od Intelu. Na macOS 14 a novějším je využíván framework Apple Accelerate, který také vede ke zrychlení.
articles.title: NumPy 2.0.0 má rychlejší řazení s použitím knihovny Highway

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Linux je v síťovém prostředí jako doma, může zastat prakticky všechny potřebné role od směrovače (router), přes DHCP, DNS až po souborový server Samba pro Microsoft Windows. Přijďte se to všechno naučit na naše třídenní školení s názvem Linux: správa počítačové sítě.
articles.title: Linux a správa počítačové sítě (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Atom)
articles.description: Před rokem Evropský parlament hlasoval proti zavedení Chat Control. Hlasování o povinném skenování soukromých zpráv je ovšem zpět a hlasování proběhne už ve středu 19 června.
articles.title: Evropský parlament bude znovu hlasovat o povinném skenování soukromých zpráv

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: V jádře 6.10 bude počáteční podpora pro modrou obrazovku smrti (BSOD), nechvalně známou z Windows, kde se objevila v NT 3.1. Javier Martinez Canillas z Red Hatu v sobotu ukázal, jak bude modrá obrazovka smrti vypadat v Linuxu.
articles.title: Modrá obrazovka smrti v jádře 6.10 bude určena běžným uživatelům

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Tým pro dlouhodobou podporu Debianu (LTS) oznámil, že pětiletá prodloužená podpora Debianu 10 Buster skončí 30. června 2024, tedy téměř pět let po jeho prvním vydání 6. července 2019. Od července tedy už nebude Debian 10 dostávat další bezpečnostní aktualizace. Další bezpečnostní záplaty je možné získat pomocí komerčních nabídek třetí strany (ELTS).
articles.title: Konec pětileté prodloužené podpory pro Debian 10 Buster

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Mozilla dostala od Roskomnadzoru požadavek, aby ve svém obchodu permanentně zablokovala pět doplňků, které jsou „zneužívány k obcházení cenzury“ v Rusku. Šlo o Censor Tracker, Runet Censorship Bypas, dvě VPN služby Planet VPN a FastProxy. Vlastní VPN od Mozilly je dostupné jen ve 33 státech a Rusko mezi nimi není (u nás ano).
articles.title: Mozilla blokovala v Rusku doplňky, které obchází cenzuru. Nyní už vše funguje

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: V sobotu policie zatkla tureckého studenta, který podváděl u standardní zkoušky TYT na univerzitě v jihozápadní provincii Isparta. Podvod byl sofistikovaný. V botě měl ukrytý router s přístupem na internet. Otázky snímal kamerou zamaskovanou jako knoflík a odpovědi mu umělá inteligence četla přímo do sluchátka v uchu.
articles.title: Turecký student podváděl u zkoušky na univerzitě pomocí AI

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Evropské centrum pro digitální práva noyb podává stížnost na Privacy Sandbox v Chrome. Ten si uživatelé mohou zapnout od loňského roku (opt-in), což by mělo funkčně nahradit sledovací cookies třetích stran. Ty snad budou již příští rok vypnuté?
articles.title: noyb podává stížnost na Privacy Sandbox v Chrome

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: AMD Fast CPPC (Collaborative Processor Performance Control) je vlastnost procesorů Zen4 a novějších, která umožňuje rychlejší přepínání frekvencí procesoru. To jednak zvyšuje výkon a také snižuje spotřebu.
articles.title: AMD Fast CPPC bude v jádře 6.11

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Poptávka po IT odbornících v oblasti kvality a testování softwaru roste. Vývojáři se snaží psát kód tak, aby fungoval správně, ale mohou přehlédnout některé chyby. Taková chyba ale může způsobit velké problémy. Tester je proto nepostradatelnou součástí vývojového procesu a je zásadním prvkem vývoje softwaru. Dívá se na software z pohledu uživatele a pomáhá vše ladit k dokonalosti.
articles.title: Testing Akademie: naučte se testovat kvalitu softwaru v online kurzu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Nový AI pomocník do Windows 11 Recall měl vyjít již příští týden 18. června. Recall ukládá snímky obrazovky, aby si uživatel mohl později najít, co na počítači dělal. Uživatelé však novou funkci nepřijali s nadšením, mají obavy o své soukromí.
articles.title: Kontroverzní Recall ve Windows 11 měl vyjít již příští týden, ale bude odložen na neurčito

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: anonymní)
articles.description: Google oznámil přechod ChromeOS ze standardního linuxového jádra na jádro ze systému Android. Důvodem je integrace frameworků z Androidu s cílem jednoduše používat aplikace z Androidu v ChromeOS bez mezivrstev.
articles.title: ChromeOS opouští čisté linuxové jádro

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Canonical dnes zveřejnil informace o počítači DC-ROMA RISC-V II od společnosti DeepComputing. Půjde o osmijádrový notebook s procesorem využívajícím architekturu RISC-V, na kterém bude předinstalovaná linuxová distribuce Ubuntu.
articles.title: DC-ROMA II bude osmijádrový notebook s RISC-V a Ubuntu

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Trend DevOps se zadrhl a už nezvyšuje produktivitu. 66 % společností v ČR plně využívá AI nebo to brzy plánuje. Podniky migrují aplikace z virtuálních počítačů na kontejnery Kubernetes. WD představuje novou strukturu způsobu ukládání dat v průběhu pracovního datového cyklu AI. Od 5G k 5.5G. Proč půltá generace?
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Trend DevOps se zadrhl a už nezvyšuje produktivitu

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Přeměnu mezi skyrmiony a antiskyrmiony demonstrovali i při pokojové teplotě. Superhmotné černé díry vznikají jinak, než si astronomové mysleli. 3D tisk z ledu vytváří umělé cévy.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Časový krystal v polovodiči by mohl pomoci optickým počítačům

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Pololetí rozsekává ceny softwarových licencí, a tím poskytuje další uspokojení těm, kteří hledají nové a ideální řešení pro jejich studijní a pracovní stanice. V současné době jsou na obchodním portálu Goodoffer24.com licence pro Windows a Office se slevami až 91 %: jednoduše použijte vhodný kód exkluzivního kupónu (viz následující instrukce, abyste mohli uplatnit extra slevu při dokončování nákupu) a získali domů nejlepší software za nejlepší cenu.
articles.title: Windows 11 za €20, 10 jen za €14: pololetní slevy až 91 % na Goodoffer24

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 24/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Přehled květnových vydání Jaderných novin: stav vydání jádra, citáty týdne a seznam článků týkajících se jádra.
articles.title: Jaderné noviny – přehled za květen 2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Nové paměťové zařízení otevírá cestu pro výpočty s umělou inteligencí v extrémních podmínkách. Nabídka Dell AI Factory se rozšiřuje. Popularita Česka jako destinace pro digitální obory roste. IBM a Salesforce rozšiřují partnerství na podporu otevřených a důvěryhodných ekosystémů umělé inteligence a dat. Taktik partnerem pro high-end bezpečnost Thales. Cloud, AI a automatizace pro odvětví telekomunikací: Umění možného.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Popularita Česka jako destinace pro digitální obory roste

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 23/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Dysonovy sféry nedávají smysl. Nové možnosti 3D tisku z kovů. Desetinná čárka je o 150 let starší. Planeta Vulkán ze StarTreku neexistuje. Slovensko chystá superpočítač Perun.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Umělá inteligence opět porazila lidi v kreativitě

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Nová řada notebooků TravelMate AI. Největším rizikem pro poskytovatele řízených služeb i jejich klienty je nedostatek dovedností v oblasti kybernetické bezpečnosti. Do Česka přichází Farseer, slibuje revoluci ve finančním plánování. Příliš mnoho výstrah a zvětšující se stínové IT narušují firemní bezpečnost. Vývojáři musí řešit problémy aplikací, místo aby vytvářeli nové. Digitální dvojčata se stávají nezbytností. Dell zvyšuje výkon, odolnost a efektivitu úložiště PowerStore. Brainware – co to vůbec je?
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Vývojáři musí řešit problémy aplikací, místo aby vytvářeli nové

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Poprvé změřili rotaci supermasivní černé díry. Původ magnetického pole Slunce by se mohl nacházet blízko povrchu. Chirální fonony dokážou opravdová kouzla. Žebříček superpočítačů Green500.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz:  Postoupili ve snaze najít kvantovou povahu gravitace

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Ať už hledáte levnější způsob jak postavit nový počítač, nebo jen upgradovat stárnoucí kopii Office, tato nabídka na Goodoffer24.com vám určitě pomůže, protože je skvělá, tak na co čekat?
articles.title: Zvláštní slevy na software v pololetí, Windows 11 za €20 a mnoho dalších na Goodoffer24

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Mapnik (Wikipedie), tj. open source toolkit pro vykreslování map a vývoj mapových aplikací, byl vydán ve verzi 4.0.0. Přehled změn na GitHubu.
articles.title: Mapnik 4.0.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Mozilla koupila firmu Anonym, tj. průkopníka v "digitální reklamě chránící soukromí".
articles.title: Mozilla koupila firmu Anonym

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Knihovna htmx (Wikipedie, GitHub), tj. knihovna rozšiřující HTML o nové atributy a umožňující vývoj dynamických webových aplikací, byla vydána ve verzi 2.0 (𝕏).
articles.title: htmx 2.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Společnosti DeepComputing a Framework Computer společně představily RISC-V základní desku pro modulární Framework Laptop 13.
articles.title: RISC-V základní deska pro Framework Laptop 13

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová verze 6.4 živé linuxové distribuce Tails (The Amnesic Incognito Live System), jež klade důraz na ochranu soukromí uživatelů a anonymitu. Přehled změn v příslušném seznamu. Tor Browser byl povýšen na verzi 13.0.16.
articles.title: Tails 6.4

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Desktopové prostředí KDE Plasma bylo vydáno ve verzi 6.1 (Mastodon, 𝕏). Přehled novinek i s videi a se snímky obrazovky v oficiálním oznámení. Podrobný přehled v seznamu změn.
articles.title: KDE Plasma 6.1

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Qsynth dospěl do verze 1.0.0. Jedná se o Qt GUI nad softwarovým syntezátorem FluidSynth (Wikipedie).
articles.title: Qsynth 1.0.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: V bezdrátových routerech od společnosti routerech D-Link, v řadách EAGLE PRO AI a AQUILA PRO AI, je zabudovaný backdoor. Jedná se o zranitelnosti CVE-2024-6044 a CVE-2024-6045. Kdokoli z lokální sítě může přístupem na konkrétní URL spustit službu Telnet a přihlásit se pomocí přihlašovacích údajů správce získaných analýzou firmwaru.
articles.title: Zabudovaný backdoor v bezdrátových routerech D-Link (CVE-2024-6044 a CVE-2024-6045)

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Organizace IuRe (Iuridicum Remedium) varuje před návrhem, který představilo belgické předsednictví Rady EU. Populární služby jako Messenger, WhatsApp nebo Signal by dle něj bylo možné plně používat až po odsouhlasení kontroly komunikace. Ta by měla zamezit šíření dětské pornografie. Podle IuRe by však taková kontrola přinesla hlavně závažný dopad na soukromí uživatelů.
articles.title: Soukromé zprávy v Messenger, WhatsApp nebo Signal by nově mohly být kontrolovány

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: NumPy (Wikipedie), tj. knihovna pro Python pro vědecké výpočty, byla po 18 letech vydána v nové major verzi 2.0.0. Přehled novinek v poznámkách k vydání. Důležité informace v průvodci migrací.
articles.title: NumPy 2.0.0

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Building off the Xe2 foundation in place for the Lunar Lake integrated graphics, more recently Intel's open-source Linux graphics driver engineers have begun pushing out code focused on enabling the Xe2-based Battlemage discrete GPUs as the successor to the DG2/Alchemist hardware. That enablement work remains ongoing and with the upcoming Linux 6.11 kernel cycle the important fundamental milestone is being crossed of actually being able to drive a connected display/monitor by a Battlemage GPU...
articles.title: Linux 6.11 To Enable Intel Battlemage GPU Display Support

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Mike Blumenkrantz of Valve's open-source Linux GPU driver team and known for his work on the Zink OpenGL-on-Vulkan driver has issued a proposal for creating a new legacy branch for older/less-maintained Gallium3D drivers...
articles.title: Proposal For Creating A New Mesa Legacy Driver Branch: R300, R600, Lima, NV30 & More

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While it looked like all of the Intel Lunar Lake support was wrapped up with the first of these next-gen Core Ultra laptops set to debut next quarter and the Panther Lake bring-up for Linux has begun, it looks like there may be some stragglers still around Lunar Lake. Sent out today was the patch series enabling DLVR (Digital Linear Voltage Regulator) support for these upcoming mobile SoCs...
articles.title: Linux Patches Posted For Intel Lunar Lake DLVR Support

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The first release candidate of Zlib-ng 2.2 for this drop-in replacement to the Zlib data compression library is now available for testing. Zlib-ng continues to ship new performance optimizations and other tuning for providing faster Zlib performance on modern processors...
articles.title: Zlib-ng 2.2 Speeds Up Compression By ~12% On x86_64 CPUs

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: AMD today announced the ROCm 6.1.3 open-source GPU compute stack. While a point release, this new ROCm revision comes with several notable refinements...
articles.title: AMD Announces ROCm 6.1.3 With Better Multi-GPU Support, Beta-Level WSL2

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Sent out last month were the very preliminary Rust-written Nova GPU kernel driver patches for this in-development Direct Rendering Manager driver for open-source NVIDIA GPU support for RTX 20 / Turing GPUs and newer by leveraging the NVIDIA GPU System Processor (GSP). Sent out this week is the second iteration of the stubbed Nova kernel driver and the associated Rust language DRM subsystem abstractions...
articles.title: Updated DRM Rust Abstractions For Linux As Part Of Bringing Up The Nova Driver

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: For those running the command "systemd-tmpfiles --purge" and think that this command just deletes your temporary files, think again and watch out. In reality it will delete all files and directories created by a tmpfiles.d entry... Including the /home that is created by systemd-tmpfiles' home.conf. With users being bitten in recent days by this behavior when they were just expecting tmp files to be removed, systemd 256.1 is now available and does have a change to avoid inadvertently deleting your all-important home directory...
articles.title: Systemd 256.1 Fixes "systemd-tmpfiles" Unexpectedly Deleting Your /home Directory

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Linux kernel "FORCE_NR_CPUS" Kconfig option has been around a few years to force the number of CPU cores the kernel expects in order to allow for better compiler optimizations. When building a kernel targeted for a specific device/platform with a given number of CPU cores, the compiler can optimize CPU mask routines and shrink the size of the resulting kernel image rather than having to accommodate up to a dynamic upper-limit for the number of CPU cores to be found at boot time. Linus Torvalds himself has turned to demoting this CONFIG_FORCE_NR_CPUS option further to avoid confusion...
articles.title: Linus Torvalds Demotes "FORCE_NR_CPUS" Embedded Linux Option To Avoid Confusion

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While Intel Panther Lake processors aren't expected until at least mid-2025, with Intel open-source Linux engineers already having much of the Arrow Lake and Lunar Lake support in order (the main Lunar Lake area still being ironed out is the Xe2 graphics), work is slowly beginning on upstreaming Panther Lake support...
articles.title: Intel Panther Lake Audio Support Coming With Linux 6.11

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Fedora Engineering and Steering Committee has approved of Fedora 41 switching from power-profiles-daemon to "Tuned" as the default power profile management daemon on Fedora Workstation as well as the KDE Plasma and Budgie desktop spins...
articles.title: Fedora 41 To Replace Power-Profiles-Daemon With "Tuned"

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Framework Computer Inc announced today that they have been working with DeepComputing on a partner-developed RISC-V motherboard for the Framework Laptop 13...
articles.title: Framework Laptop 13 To See A RISC-V Motherboard Option

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Right on schedule today KDE released Plasma 6.1 as the first feature update to the Plasma 6 desktop stack that debuted back in February...
articles.title: KDE Plasma 6.1 Released With Easier Remote Desktop Support, Wayland Explicit Sync

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Announced back in March by the Linux Foundation was Valkey as a Redis fork following upstream licensing changes. In the few months since the Valkey in-memory NoSQL data store has put out its first release and has continued attracting more interest from Linux/open-source communities. Today the Linux Foundation announced another handful of organizations now throwing their weight behind Valkey...
articles.title: More Companies Now Backing Valkey As Leading Redis Fork

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Portable Computing Language "PoCL" that started off as a CPU-based OpenCL implementation has grown to support multiple hardware targets from NVIDIA PTX to Intel Level Zero to AMD ROCm and other innovations like a recent remote driver for transparent OpenCL across networked systems. PoCL 6.0 was released today for delivering the latest enhancements to this independent OpenCL compute implementation and continuing to enhance support for its different hardware targets...
articles.title: PoCL 6.0 OpenCL Implementation Brings OpenMP For CPU Driver, More Remote Driver Features

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Well known AMD Mesa developer Marek Olšák has shown no signs of hitting the end of the road for optimizing OpenGL support within the Mesa/Gallium3D driver stack. More than one decade since joining AMD and more than a decade and a half of being involved with Mesa since beginning as a student developer, Marek still isn't slowing down with his performance optimizations and new features to benefit the open-source Radeon Linux graphics drivers...
articles.title: Marek Olšák Lands Support In Mesa 24.2 To Vectorize IO In The GLSL Linker

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: A set of patches for the Linux kernel's Intel P-State driver aim to ensure Intel Xeon servers can hit their highest clock frequencies following changes in the server's performance profile. It turns out some special handling is needed to update the highest frequencies of a CPU after boot to ensure the performance profile is properly reflected...
articles.title: New Linux Patches To Help Ensure Intel Xeon Servers Can Achieve Highest Frequencies

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Fedora developers are hoping that the long-awaited GIMP 3.0 will ship before October and be all ready for serving as the default GIMP package with the in-development Fedora 41...
articles.title: Fedora 41 Hopes The GIMP 3.0 Photoshop Alternative Will Be Ready To Shine

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: A set of patches were posted on Monday in aiming to get aging AMD Radeon GFX7/GFX8 era graphics processors working on Loongson LoongArch platforms. These patches for handling old Radeon Hawaii~Polaris GPUs on Loongson point to a "massive platform bug" with these domestic Chinese systems...
articles.title: Patches For AMD GPUs On Loongson Point To "Massive Platform Bug" For These Chinese CPUs

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Last week marked the inaugural release of the X.Org Testing Ground Toolkit to make it easier to compile the X.Org Server. That v0.0.1 release was limited to supporting Debian/Apt-based Linux distributions while now this helper toolkit has been extended to support FreeBSD and NetBSD too...
articles.title: X.Org Testing Ground Toolkit v0.0.2 Adds NetBSD & FreeBSD Support

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With the release of Fedora 41 in October, this Red Hat sponsored Linux distribution is hoping to have all the software bits aligned that its AMD SEV-SNP virtualization stack will be all squared away for this latest iteration of Secure Encrypted Virtualization...
articles.title: Fedora 41 Aims To Ship AMD SEV-SNP Confidential Virtualization Host Support

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel today released OpenVINO 2024.2, the newest version of its open-source AI toolkit for optimizing and deploying deep learning (A) inference models across a range of AI frameworks and broad hardware types...
articles.title: Intel Releases OpenVINO 2024.2 With Llama 3 Optimizations, More AVX2 & AVX-512 Optimizations

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: As a planned change for Fedora 41, Red Hat engineers are working on upstream GNOME Software better supporting the NVIDIA proprietary driver installation by allowing the installation to work gracefully with UEFI Secure Boot enabled systems...
articles.title: GNOME Software To Better Support NVIDIA's Proprietary Linux Driver

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: After last week looking at how FreeBSD 14.1 has improved performance over FreeBSD 14.0, here is an expanded cross-OS comparison now looking at how the new FreeBSD 14.1 stable release compares to the recently released NetBSD 10.0, the current DragonFlyBSD 6.4 release, and then CentOS Stream 9 and Ubuntu 24.04 LTS for some Linux comparison data points.
articles.title: FreeBSD 14.1 vs. DragonFlyBSD 6.4 vs. NetBSD 10 vs. Linux Benchmarks

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Germany's Sovereign Tech Fund has been making sizable investments into various Linux desktop projects, the Rust-based Coreutils implementation, libmicrohttpd, PHP, a systemd bug bounty, and other prominent open-source software that could benefit from greater financial resources. Today they have announced they have opened up for a new round of applications for those open-source projects seeking funding from this German government initiative...
articles.title: Sovereign Tech Fund Opens Up To Smaller Investments & Updated Criteria

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel's Open Image Denoise open-source software that is a denoising library used by Blender and other applications is out with a new feature release as it prepares for the integrated graphics of upcoming Arrow Lake and Lunar Lake processors as well as nearing the launch of Xe2 / Battlemage discrete graphics...
articles.title: Open Image Denoise 2.3 Prepares For Arrow Lake, Lunar Lake & Battlemage

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Within the every increasingly complex world of CPU security mitigations, Intel engineers have submitted Linux kernel patches to begin taking into account the CPU core "hybrid" topology when determining relevant CPU security vulnerabilities and in turn the mitigations to apply...
articles.title: Linux To Incorporate Intel CPU Hybrid Topology For Determining Vulnerabilities/Mitigations

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Two new change proposals have been filed for enhancing the KDE offerings with this autumn's Fedora 41 release...
articles.title: Fedora 41 Looks To Offer A KDE Plasma Mobile Spin

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: NumPy 2.0 was released on Sunday that's been in the making for the past year and their first major release since 2006. While it comes with API/ABI breakage, NumPy 2.0 delivers new features and performance improvements...
articles.title: NumPy 2.0 Brings Faster Performance Thanks To Intel's x86-simd-sort & Google's Highway

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While at the start of 2023 was talk among kernel developers for orphaning the JFS file-system at a time that developers began the processes toward removing the ReiserFS file-system driver, the Journaled File-System so far remains within the mainline kernel and not yet officially orphaned...
articles.title: The JFS File-System Remains In Sad Shape With The Upstream Linux Kernel

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Linus Torvalds as the father of the Linux kernel set aside some time this Father's Day to release Linux 6.10-rc4...
articles.title: Linux 6.10-rc4 Released With Another Week Worth Of Driver Fixes

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: IceWM 3.6 is out today as the newest version of this lightweight X11 window manager...
articles.title: IceWM 3.6 Released With A Few New Features & Fixes

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Debuting last week was FreeBSD 14.1 with performance improvements and more. Given there being some performance optimizations and other upgrades like a more recent LLVM Clang compiler by default, I've begun running some benchmarks of this newest FreeBSD stable release. In today's article is a quick comparison of FreeBSD 14.1 vs. FreeBSD 14.0 performance using an AMD Ryzen Threadripper 7980X 64-core processor within the System76 Thelio Major workstation.

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
The Nuno Mendes Make Your Mark is now live in EA FC 24, and interestingly, EA Sports has offered it in the form of an objective. 


In simple words, everyone will be able to obtain this card by completing all the tasks that are part of the objective set. However, it's important to understand the conditions associated with all the tasks, which will help players complete them quicker (and unlock the new promo card sooner). 


EA FC 24 Nuno Mendes Make Your Mark objective tasks


The latest objective set has eight different tasks, and all of them have to be completed in the Champions game mode. 


Image via EA Sports



Play 3: Play 3 matches in any Champions Game Mode while having a Full Squad of players from Argentina.


Play 6: Play 6 matches in any Champions Game Mode while having a Full Squad of players from Argentina.


Play 9: Play 9 matches in any Champions Game Mode while having a Full Squad of players from Argentina.


Play 11: Play 11 matches in any Champions Game Mode while having a Full Squad of players from Argentina.


Win 4: Win 4 matches in Champions Finals while having a Full Squad of players from Argentina.


Win 6: Win 6 matches in Champions Finals while having a Full Squad of players from Argentina.


Win 10: Win 10 matches in Champions Finals while having a Full Squad of players from Argentina.


Win 12: Win 12 matches in Champions Finals while having a Full Squad of players from Argentina.



Completing the EA FC 24 Nuno Mendes Make Your Mark objective won't be easy as getting 12 wins in Champions Finals, only using Argentine cards, is pretty difficult. However, the 95-rated LB item is pretty meta, and obtaining such an item for free is well worth the extra effort. 

The post EA FC 24: How to get Nuno Mendes Make Your Mark card for free? appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: EA FC 24: How to get Nuno Mendes Make Your Mark card for free?

articles.author: Madison Benson
articles.description:
In BitLife, pursuing any medical career is difficult, especially as you spend most of your early adult life in school and tackle student loans. Although the route to becoming a veterinarian differs slightly, it still has some challenges.


How to become a Vet in BitLife


Becoming a veterinarian in BitLife requires graduating from university with either a chemistry or biology degree before completing veterinary school. Graduating with any other degree type, including those under the science umbrella, will still make you unqualified for veterinary school, so chemistry or biology are your best options.


Graduate from university with a chemistry or biology degree


The first part of doing this involves your character aging up with high smarts stats. While maxing it isn't required, high smart…
articles.title: How to become a Veterinarian in BitLife

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
Taking its inspiration from the Shunsui Kyoraku character from Bleach, Theatre is a Shikai/Bankai Element for Shinigami in Type Soul. It’s a rather powerful one, so let's take a closer look at it.


Theatre is a Legendary Shikai Element. This means that it has a drop rate of 3%. Once you receive your Shikai, if it’s not the one you want (which I assume is Theatre in this case) you’ll need to use a reroll to try your luck again.


Getting Shikai is an early task for Shinigami. For full instructions, you can check here. Then in order to get Bankai, you’ll need to jump a great many more hurdles, which are outlined right over here.


Shikai


Z - Kageoni - This causes you to teleport behind your opponent with an opening attack. It will ragdoll the opponent and can be followed up with a combo.


X - Wraith - A quicker but less flashy teleport that will move you in front of your opponent with an attack.


C - Iro Oni - This puts you in a stance. If your opponent hits you while you’re in this stance, you’ll teleport (of course) and hit them from behind, causing them to ragdoll.


Bankai


T - Plague - This is an AOE (area of effect) move that will mark all the enemies in your vicinity. After a few moments, it will stun and damage the enemies.


G - Final Play - This has a long(ish) windup that then releases a massive slash in front of your character. It guard breaks anyone in range and does massive damage.

The post Type Soul Theatre build guide appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Type Soul Theatre build guide
